p: Interestingly, the time-of-addition assay showed that the additional supply of the essential oils of CC and PG prior or during or the viral adsorption (pre-treatment or co-treatment) provides the most significant inhibition of the viral replication ( Fig 6A). The viral replication was also reduced in post-treatment ( Fig 6A), but only the PG essential oil exhibited a marked effect on the residual infectivity ( Fig 6B). This latter result suggests that the PG essential oil may also interfere with the post-transcriptional stage of the virus life cycle.
